supplier-market-company-result.name: Basware
supplier-market-company-result.description: Basware is the only procure-to-pay and e-invoicing solution provider that empowers businesses with 100% spend visibility through 100% data capture. Its cloud-based technology enables organizations to fully manage their spending, mitigate financial risk and reduce the cost of operations via automation.  It was founded in 2002 and headquartered in Fort Mill, South Carolina.
supplier-market-company-result.hqAddress: 1245 Rosemont Dr, Fort Mill, 29707, South Carolina, USA

competitors.name: Coupa Software

competitors.name: Zycus
competitors.description: Zycus Inc. designs and develops spend analysis software solutions. competitors.name: PurchaseControl
competitors.description:
PurchaseControl.com provides purchase management software that is cloud based. Create and track purchase requisitions and orders, automated control of budgets, transactions and vendors. With PurchaseControl you can automate the entire process:

1. Set budgets for departments and for individuals

2. Set preferred vendors and predetermined line items by each vendor

3. Have multiple levels of approval, which are triggered automatically based on the value of the transaction

4. Set automated credit terms with your vendors

5. Generated consolidated reports by department, by individual, by budget, but a line item, by timeline, or by a combination of any of them.

competitors.name: Precoro
competitors.description: Precoro is a provider of cloud-based spend management software for small and mid-size business.

competitors.name: Market Dojo
competitors.description: Market Dojo is an e-Procurement software company based in Stonehouse, England. The company was established in 2010 by Nick Drewe, Alun Rafique, and Nic Martin. Alun previously worked at Rolls-Royce before meeting Nick Drewe at Vendigital, whilst Nic Martin came from Attensity. All three co-founders studied at Bristol University. The company's competitors include Ariba, Curtis Fitch, and Scan market amongst others.

competitors.name: PROACTIS SA
competitors.description: Proactis provides technological services. The Company offers cloud computing, data usage, digital solutions, software, networks, and infrastructures. Proactis serves customers worldwide.

supplier-market-company-result.name: VerticalNet
supplier-market-company-result.description: Verticalnet, Inc. was a host of 43 business-to-business (B2B) procurement portals headquartered in Horsham, Pennsylvania. It was famous for its market capitalization of $10.89 billion on March 10, 2000, during the dot-com bubble, despite sales of only $112.5 million in 2000. Verticalnet was acquired by Bravo Solutions in 2008 for $15.2 million.

competitors.description: Sourceit was originally conceived and developed in 2010 as specialized sourcing, job and order management software for marketing services, our Market, and Catalog modules.Their new software module, RFQ was created to meet the growing demand from clients who wanted a simpler and easier way to create and manage RFQs.Sourceit was created to achieve one key goal, simplify the RFQ process and make life easier for buyers all over the world

competitors.name: Zycus
competitors.description: Zycus Inc. designs and develops spend analysis software solutions. The Company offers applications for both the strategic and operational aspects of procurement, eInvoicing, spend analysis, eSourcing, contract management, and financial savings management services. Zycus Infotech serves clients in the State of New Jersey.

competitors.name: PurchaseControl
competitors.description:
PurchaseControl.com provides purchase management software that is cloud based. Create and track purchase requisitions and orders, automated control of budgets, transactions and vendors. With PurchaseControl you can automate the entire process:

1. Set budgets for departments and for individuals

2. Set preferred vendors and predetermined line items by each vendor

3. Have multiple levels of approval, which are triggered automatically based on the value of the transaction

4. Set automated credit terms with your vendors

5. Generated consolidated reports by department, by individual, by budget, but a line item, by timeline, or by a combination of any of them.
